description: Difference between n^2 and average of smallest prime greater than n^2 and largest prime less than n^2.
example: a(4)=1 because smallest prime greater than 4^2 is 17, largest prime less than 4^2 is 13, average of 17 and 13 is 15 and 16-15=1
author: _Henry Bottomley_, Jul 12 2000
extensions: More terms from _James A. Sellers_, Jul 13 2000
